intro: Monnina tomentella, commonly known as the woolly monnina, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
